Carrier Pigeons: Carrier pigeons are trained birds that can be used to deliver messages over long distances. In the absence of electronic communication, carrier pigeons could be used to send letters or small packages between countries. This method would be slower than electronic communication but would provide a reliable and secure means of communication.

Telegraphs: Telegraphs use Morse code to transmit messages over wires. While telegraphs are no longer widely used for personal communication, they could be used to send messages between countries in the event of an electronic communication blackout. This method would be slower than electronic communication but would provide a reliable means of communication.

Homing Pigeons: Homing pigeons are trained birds that can find their way back to their home location. In the event of an electronic communication blackout, homing pigeons could be used to send messages between countries. This method would be slower than electronic communication but would provide a reliable means of communication.

Signal Fires: Signal fires are used to communicate messages by using a series of fires to convey a message. In the event of an electronic communication blackout, signal fires could be used to send messages between countries. This method would be slower than electronic communication but would provide a reliable means of communication.

Smoke Signals: Smoke signals are used to communicate messages by using smoke to convey a message. In the event of an electronic communication blackout, smoke signals could be used to send messages between countries. This method would be slower than electronic communication but would provide a reliable means of communication.
